maml:description.maml:para: Gets the summary of the currently active PHP version on the specified IIS web site and application.
The Get-PHPConfiguration cmdlet gets the summary of the currently active PHP version on the site specified by "SiteName" parameter and on the application/folder specified by "VirtualPath" parameter.
Specifies a name of existing web site. The cmdlet will use the PHP version that is active for that web site. If this parameter is not specified then PHP version on a server level will be used.

Specifies a path within a web site. The cmdlet will use the PHP version that is active for that configuration path within a web site. If this parameter is not specified then PHP version for the root directory of web site will be used.
Specifies a name of existing web site. The cmdlet will use the PHP version that is active for that web site. If this parameter is not specified then PHP version on a server level will be used.

Specifies a path within a web site. The cmdlet will use the PHP version that is active for that configuration path within a web site. If this parameter is not specified then PHP version for the root directory of web site will be used.

dev:remarks.maml:para: This command returns the summary of PHP version on IIS server level. That version is used on all the sites on that IIS server, unless they explicitly overwrite it.

HandlerName : php-5.3.6 Version : 5.3.6 ScriptProcessor : C:\php\536\php-cgi.exe HandlerType : Local ErrorLog : C:\Windows\Temp\php-5.3.6_errors.log PHPIniFilePath : C:\php\536\php.ini InstalledExtensionsCount : 36 EnabledExtensionsCount : 0
This command returns the summary of PHP version that is used for the directory "/forum" on a site with name "mysite".

maml:description.maml:para: Gets the list of PHP extensions available in the currently active PHP version.
The Get-PHPExtension cmdlet outputs the list of all PHP extensions available in the currently active PHP version. The list can be filtered by extension name and by the status (enabled or disabled).
Specifies the name of the extensions to output. If the parameter is not specified then all available extensions will be listed. This parameter supports wildcards.

Specifies the status of the extension. Possible values are "enabled" and "disabled". Only the extension that match the specified status will be listed. If this parameter is not specified then all extensions will be listed.
Specifies a name of existing web site. The cmdlet will use the PHP version that is active for that web site. If this parameter is not specified then PHP version on a server level will be used.

Specifies a path within a web site. The cmdlet will use the PHP version that is active for that configuration path within a web site. If this parameter is not specified then PHP version for the root directory of web site will be used.
Specifies the name of the extensions to output. If the parameter is not specified then all available extensions will be listed. This parameter supports wildcards.

Specifies the status of the extension. Possible values are "enabled" and "disabled". Only the extension that match the specified status will be listed. If this parameter is not specified then all extensions will be listed.
Specifies a name of existing web site. The cmdlet will use the PHP version that is active for that web site. If this parameter is not specified then PHP version on a server level will be used.

Specifies a path within a web site. The cmdlet will use the PHP version that is active for that configuration path within a web site. If this parameter is not specified then PHP version for the root directory of web site will be used.

dev:remarks.maml:para: This command lists all the extensions that are available for the currently active PHP version.
This command returns the list of extensions available in PHP version that is used for the directory "/forum" on a site with name "mysite".
This command lists all the enabled PHP extension that have "pdo" in their name.
Name Status ---- ------ php_pdo_firebird.dll Enabled php_pdo_mysql.dll Enabled php_pdo_oci.dll Enabled php_pdo_odbc.dll Enabled php_pdo_pgsql.dll Enabled php_pdo_sqlite.dll Enabled

maml:description.maml:para: Gets the list of configuration settings for currently active PHP version.

The Get-PHPSetting cmdlet gets the list of configurations settings for currently active PHP version on the site specified by "SiteName" parameter and on the application/folder specified by "VirtualPath" parameter.
Specifies the name of a PHP setting. If this parameter is not specified then all PHP settings will be listed. This parameter supports wildcards syntax.
Specifies the PHP.INI section where settings belong to. If this parameter is specified then only the settings from the specified section will be listed.
Specifies a name of existing web site. The cmdlet will use the PHP version that is active for that web site. If this parameter is not specified then PHP version on a server level will be used.

Specifies a path within a web site. The cmdlet will use the PHP version that is active for that configuration path within a web site. If this parameter is not specified then PHP version for the root directory of web site will be used.
Specifies the name of a PHP setting. If this parameter is not specified then all PHP settings will be listed. This parameter supports wildcards syntax.
Specifies the PHP.INI section where settings belong to. If this parameter is specified then only the settings from the specified section will be listed.
Specifies a name of existing web site. The cmdlet will use the PHP version that is active for that web site. If this parameter is not specified then PHP version on a server level will be used.

Specifies a path within a web site. The cmdlet will use the PHP version that is active for that configuration path within a web site. If this parameter is not specified then PHP version for the root directory of web site will be used.

dev:remarks.maml:para: This command lists all the configuration settings for the currently active PHP version.
This command returns the list of configuration settings for the PHP version that is used for the directory "/forum" on a site with name "mysite".
This command returns the list of configuration settings that contain "error" in their names and that belong to "PHP" section.

Name Value Section ---- ----- ------- error_reporting E_ALL & ~E_DEPRECATED PHP display_errors Off PHP display_startup_errors Off PHP log_errors On PHP log_errors_max_len 1024 PHP ignore_repeated_errors Off PHP track_errors Off PHP html_errors Off PHP error_log "C:\Windows\Temp\errors.log" PHP

maml:description.maml:para: Gets the list of all available PHP versions that are registered with IIS.

The Get-PHPVersion cmdlet gets the list of all PHP versions that are registered with IIS on the site specified by "SiteName" parameter and on the application/folder specified by "VirtualPath" parameter.
Specifies the name of the handler mapping for PHP. If this parameter is not specified then all available handler mappings will be listed. This parameter supports wildcard syntax.
Specifies a version of PHP. If this parameter is specified then only handler mappings for that PHP version will be listed. This parameter supports wildcard syntax.
Specifies a name of existing web site. The cmdlet will use the PHP version that is active for that web site. If this parameter is not specified then PHP version on a server level will be used.

Specifies a path within a web site. The cmdlet will use the PHP version that is active for that configuration path within a web site. If this parameter is not specified then PHP version for the root directory of web site will be used.
Specifies the name of the handler mapping for PHP. If this parameter is not specified then all available handler mappings will be listed. This parameter supports wildcard syntax.
Specifies a version of PHP. If this parameter is specified then only handler mappings for that PHP version will be listed. This parameter supports wildcard syntax.
Specifies a name of existing web site. The cmdlet will use the PHP version that is active for that web site. If this parameter is not specified then PHP version on a server level will be used.

Specifies a path within a web site. The cmdlet will use the PHP version that is active for that configuration path within a web site. If this parameter is not specified then PHP version for the root directory of web site will be used.

dev:remarks.maml:para: This command lists all the PHP versions registered with IIS on a server level.

HandlerName Version ScriptProcessor Active ----------- ------- --------------- ------ php-5.3.6 5.3.6 C:\php\536\php-cgi.exe True php-5.2.16 5.2.16 C:\php\5216\php-cgi.exe False php-5.3.1 5.3.1 C:\php\531\php-cgi.exe False
This command returns all the versions of PHP that are configured for the directory "/forum" on a site with name "mysite".

maml:description.maml:para: Adds new PHP configuration setting to the currently active PHP version.

The New-PHPSetting cmdlet adds a new PHP configuration setting to the PHP version that is currently active on the site specified by "SiteName" parameter and on the application/folder specified by "VirtualPath" parameter.
Specifies the name of the setting to be added.
Specifies the value of the setting to be added.
Specifies the name of the section that the setting belongs to. If this parameter is not specified then the setting will be added to "PHP" section.
Specifies a name of existing web site. The cmdlet will use the PHP version that is active for that web site. If this parameter is not specified then PHP version on a server level will be used.

Specifies a path within a web site. The cmdlet will use the PHP version that is active for that configuration path within a web site. If this parameter is not specified then PHP version for the root directory of web site will be used.
Describes what would happen if you executed the command without actually executing the command.
Prompts for confirmation before executing the command.
Specifies the name of the setting to be added.
Specifies the value of the setting to be added.
Specifies the name of the section that the setting belongs to. If this parameter is not specified then the setting will be added to "PHP" section.
Specifies a name of existing web site. The cmdlet will use the PHP version that is active for that web site. If this parameter is not specified then PHP version on a server level will be used.

Specifies a path within a web site. The cmdlet will use the PHP version that is active for that configuration path within a web site. If this parameter is not specified then PHP version for the root directory of web site will be used.
Describes what would happen if you executed the command without actually executing the command.
Prompts for confirmation before executing the command.

dev:remarks.maml:para: Adds a new configuration setting with name "wincache.fcndetect" and value "1" to the PHP.INI section "wincache".
This command adds new configuration settings for the PHP version that is used for the directory "/forum" on a site with name "mysite".

maml:description.maml:para: Registers new PHP version on specified IIS web site and application.

The New-PHPVersion cmdlet registers new PHP version with IIS on the site specified by "SiteName" parameter and on the application/folder specified by "VirtualPath" parameter. If neither "SiteName" nor "VirtualPath" specified then PHP will be registered on a server level.
Specifies the path to the PHP executable file - php-cgi.exe.
Specifies a name of existing web site. The cmdlet will use the PHP version that is active for that web site. If this parameter is not specified then PHP version on a server level will be used.

Specifies a path within a web site. The cmdlet will use the PHP version that is active for that configuration path within a web site. If this parameter is not specified then PHP version for the root directory of web site will be used.
Specifies the path to the PHP executable file - php-cgi.exe.
Specifies a name of existing web site. The cmdlet will use the PHP version that is active for that web site. If this parameter is not specified then PHP version on a server level will be used.

Specifies a path within a web site. The cmdlet will use the PHP version that is active for that configuration path within a web site. If this parameter is not specified then PHP version for the root directory of web site will be used.

dev:remarks.maml:para: This command registers new PHP version, whose files are located at C:\PHP\536 directory.
This command registers new version of PHP for the directory "/forum" on a site with name "mysite".

maml:description.maml:para: Removes an existing PHP setting from the currently active PHP version.

The Remove-PHPSetting cmdlet removes an existing PHP configuration setting from the PHP version that is currently active on the site specified by "SiteName" parameter and on the application/folder specified by "VirtualPath" parameter.
Suppresses all prompts. By default, Remove-PHPSetting displays a warning whenever you delete a PHP setting.
Specifies the name of the setting to be removed.
Specifies a name of existing web site. The cmdlet will use the PHP version that is active for that web site. If this parameter is not specified then PHP version on a server level will be used.

Specifies a path within a web site. The cmdlet will use the PHP version that is active for that configuration path within a web site. If this parameter is not specified then PHP version for the root directory of web site will be used.
Describes what would happen if you executed the command without actually executing the command.

Prompts you for confirmation before executing the command.
The Confirm parameter overrides the value of the $ConfirmPreference variable for the current command. The default value is High. For more information, type the following command:
get-help about_preference_variables
Suppresses all prompts. By default, Remove-PHPSetting displays a warning whenever you delete a PHP setting.
Specifies the name of the setting to be removed.
Specifies a name of existing web site. The cmdlet will use the PHP version that is active for that web site. If this parameter is not specified then PHP version on a server level will be used.

Specifies a path within a web site. The cmdlet will use the PHP version that is active for that configuration path within a web site. If this parameter is not specified then PHP version for the root directory of web site will be used.
Describes what would happen if you executed the command without actually executing the command.

Prompts you for confirmation before executing the command.
The Confirm parameter overrides the value of the $ConfirmPreference variable for the current command. The default value is High. For more information, type the following command:
get-help about_preference_variables

dev:remarks.maml:para: This command removes the PHP setting wincache.fcndetect from the configuration for the currently active PHP version without prompting for confirmation.
This command removes a configuration settings for the PHP version that is used for the directory "/forum" on a site with name "mysite".

maml:description.maml:para: Enables or disables PHP extensions for currently active PHP version.
The Set-PHPExtension cmdlet enables or disables PHP extensions available in the currently active PHP version. This cmdlet can get the name of extension from the PowerShell pipe.
Specifies the name of the extension to set.
Specifies the status to use for this extension. Allowed values are "Enabled" and "Disabled".
Specifies a name of existing web site. The cmdlet will use the PHP version that is active for that web site. If this parameter is not specified then PHP version on a server level will be used.

Specifies a path within a web site. The cmdlet will use the PHP version that is active for that configuration path within a web site. If this parameter is not specified then PHP version for the root directory of web site will be used.
Describes what would happen if you executed the command without actually executing the command.

Prompts you for confirmation before executing the command.
The Confirm parameter overrides the value of the $ConfirmPreference variable for the current command. The default value is High. For more information, type the following command:
get-help about_preference_variables
Specifies the name of the extension to set.
Specifies the status to use for this extension. Allowed values are "Enabled" and "Disabled".
Specifies a name of existing web site. The cmdlet will use the PHP version that is active for that web site. If this parameter is not specified then PHP version on a server level will be used.

Specifies a path within a web site. The cmdlet will use the PHP version that is active for that configuration path within a web site. If this parameter is not specified then PHP version for the root directory of web site will be used.
Describes what would happen if you executed the command without actually executing the command.

Prompts you for confirmation before executing the command.
The Confirm parameter overrides the value of the $ConfirmPreference variable for the current command. The default value is High. For more information, type the following command:
get-help about_preference_variables
Name of the extension.

dev:remarks.maml:para: This command enables php_wincache.dll extension.
This command enables all available extension that have "pdo" in their names.
This command enables WinCache extensio for the PHP version that is used for the directory "/forum" on a site with name "mysite".

maml:description.maml:para: Changes the value of an existing PHP setting for the currently active PHP version.

The Set-PHPSetting cmdlet changes the value of an existing PHP configuration setting for the PHP version that is currently active on the site specified by "SiteName" parameter and on the application/folder specified by "VirtualPath" parameter.
Specifies the name of the PHP setting to change.
Specifies a new value for the PHP setting.
Specifies a name of existing web site. The cmdlet will use the PHP version that is active for that web site. If this parameter is not specified then PHP version on a server level will be used.

Specifies a path within a web site. The cmdlet will use the PHP version that is active for that configuration path within a web site. If this parameter is not specified then PHP version for the root directory of web site will be used.
Describes what would happen if you executed the command without actually executing the command.

Prompts you for confirmation before executing the command.
The Confirm parameter overrides the value of the $ConfirmPreference variable for the current command. The default value is High. For more information, type the following command:
get-help about_preference_variables
Specifies the name of the PHP setting to change.
Specifies a new value for the PHP setting.
Specifies a name of existing web site. The cmdlet will use the PHP version that is active for that web site. If this parameter is not specified then PHP version on a server level will be used.

Specifies a path within a web site. The cmdlet will use the PHP version that is active for that configuration path within a web site. If this parameter is not specified then PHP version for the root directory of web site will be used.
Describes what would happen if you executed the command without actually executing the command.

Prompts you for confirmation before executing the command.
The Confirm parameter overrides the value of the $ConfirmPreference variable for the current command. The default value is High. For more information, type the following command:
get-help about_preference_variables

dev:remarks.maml:para: This command sets the PHP setting "wincache.fcndetect" to 1.
This command sets a configuration settings for the PHP version that is used for the directory "/forum" on a site with name "mysite".

maml:description.maml:para: Sets an active PHP version on specified IIS web site and application.
The Set-PHPVersion cmdlet sets an active PHP version on the site specified by "SiteName" parameter and on the application/folder specified by "VirtualPath" parameter.
Specifies the name of the handler mapping for an existing PHP version.
Specifies a name of existing web site. The cmdlet will use the PHP version that is active for that web site. If this parameter is not specified then PHP version on a server level will be used.

Specifies a path within a web site. The cmdlet will use the PHP version that is active for that configuration path within a web site. If this parameter is not specified then PHP version for the root directory of web site will be used.
Describes what would happen if you executed the command without actually executing the command.

Prompts you for confirmation before executing the command.
The Confirm parameter overrides the value of the $ConfirmPreference variable for the current command. The default value is High. For more information, type the following command:
get-help about_preference_variables
Specifies the name of the handler mapping for an existing PHP version.
Specifies a name of existing web site. The cmdlet will use the PHP version that is active for that web site. If this parameter is not specified then PHP version on a server level will be used.

Specifies a path within a web site. The cmdlet will use the PHP version that is active for that configuration path within a web site. If this parameter is not specified then PHP version for the root directory of web site will be used.
Describes what would happen if you executed the command without actually executing the command.

Prompts you for confirmation before executing the command.
The Confirm parameter overrides the value of the $ConfirmPreference variable for the current command. The default value is High. For more information, type the following command:
get-help about_preference_variables

dev:remarks.maml:para: This command sets an active PHP version that has an IIS Handler name "php-5.3.6".
This command sets an active PHP version for the directory "/forum" on a site with name "mysite".
